result.execSummary:
The defendant Katelyn A. Mares was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DOC financial screen print
Order for payment of Attorney fees of $584.63
Petition for Payment of Legal Fees and Proposed orderfor payment
with attached victim restitution request form(s)
Criminal Case Settlement
with elements
Huber Law/Work Release Notification

Case called at 2:38 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Katelyn A. Mares in court with Attorney Samantha J. Humes. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On Motion of the State, the Court AMENDS Count #1 to battery/domestic abuse, contrary to 940.19(1), 968.075(1)(a), a class A misdemeanor

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Counts #1 & #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
ADA Beck submits victim impact statement

On Counts #1 & #2, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 12 months, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
--serve 7 days in Jefferson County Jail, w/Huber/work-release privileges for purposes of employment, counseling & child care; to commence 12/1/14 at 8:00 am 
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--Maintain absolute sobriety
--No possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--Undergo domestic violence counseling if deemed appropriate per Agent
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--No acts/threats of violence towards any persons
--To pay costs of $486 ($243 each count)
--To pay $400 DNA Surcharge ($200 each count)
--To pay $200 domestic abuse surcharge ($100 each count)
--Payment of attorney fees

Days credit for time already served: 1 day
Defendant to report to Probation no later than 12:00 pm 11/14/14
Recess: 2:57 pm
from non-party re: treatment submtitted by Atty Humes with cover letter
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 13, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Scheduling Notice

Case called at 9:35 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Katelyn A. Mares in court with Attorney Samantha J. Humes. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Humes: Close to settlement, was additional treatment information needed for the State. Just received late yesterday that information. Would request a plea/sentencing date in 1 - 2 weeks. 
ADA Shock: Agreed 
Court reminds Ms. Mares that her bond/conditions of release remain in effect while case pending
Recess: 9:36 am 

NEXT: (1) Schedule Plea/Sentencing 11/13/14 at 2:30 pm (30 min)- Send notices
State's with cover letter
Status conference on October 31, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 15, 2014 at 01:20 pm.
Amended Bond as ordered by the Court on October 3, 2014

Reserve Judge Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV: 
case called at 9:32am. [MK]
Defendant Katelyn A. Mares in court with Attorney Samantha J. Humes.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Attorney Humes verifies that the address on the Criminal Complaint is correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court continues amends the current Signature Bond to modify the contact prohibition exception:     no direct or indirect contact with Luis Mares Neave, except for the purposes of child exchange, or except as necessary to discuss the care and needs of their child, or as necessary for the purpose of discussing divorce proceedings. 
recess 9:44am. 

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 10/15/14 at 1:20pm   (2) schedule Status Conference on 10/31/14 at 9:30am  (JA- please note in comments that the case is still at Prelim stage)
* FINANCIAL RECORDS *
The Court appoints Attorney Humes//repayment order of $100 a month starting 10-31-14

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.

***Minutes from 14GF51***

Case called at 1:17 pm
Defendant Katelyn Audra Mares appears in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court reviewed the Probable Cause Statement and found that it stated Probable Cause.
Attorney Svehlek informs the Court that Ms. Mares is not eligible for SPD representation.
Public Service Prosecutro Flint requests 30 days to gather some more information before a complaint is filed.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $2,500.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-No acts or threats of violence 
-No direct or indirect contact with Luis Mares-Neave, except for child exchange and must occur in a public place and only discussion should be regarding exchange of the child (exchange should only be 2-3 minutes in length anything longer will be in violation of bond)
-No discussion of the facts of the case with Savannah Lohman-Mooth  

Court grants the State 30 days to file a complaint, if no complaint is filed within 30 days the bodn shall lapse.
Court informs the Defendant that if the defendant received notice regarding a 72 hour no contact that she still has to obide by that no contact.
Recess: 1:23 pm
